<Link id="l00092" /><CodeLine lineNumber="92"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00093" /><CodeLine lineNumber="93"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Return a copy of the specified basic block, but without</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00094" /><CodeLine lineNumber="94"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// embedding the block into a particular function.  The block returned is an</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00095" /><CodeLine lineNumber="95"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// exact copy of the specified basic block, without any remapping having been</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00096" /><CodeLine lineNumber="96"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// performed.  Because of this, this is only suitable for applications where</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00097" /><CodeLine lineNumber="97"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the basic block will be inserted into the same function that it was cloned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00098" /><CodeLine lineNumber="98"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// from (loop unrolling would use this, for example).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Also, note that this function makes a direct copy of the basic block, and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// can thus produce illegal LLVM code.  In particular, it will copy any PHI</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00102" /><CodeLine lineNumber="102"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// nodes from the original block, even though there are no predecessors for the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// newly cloned block (thus, phi nodes will have to be updated).  Also, this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// block will branch to the old successors of the original block: these</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// successors will have to have any PHI nodes updated to account for the new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// incoming edges.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The correlation between instructions in the source and result basic blocks</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is recorded in the VMap map.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If you have a particular suffix you&#39;d like to use to add to any cloned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// names, specify it as the optional third parameter.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If you would like the basic block to be auto-inserted into the end of a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function, you can specify it as the optional fourth parameter.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If you would like to collect additional information about the cloned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function, you can specify a ClonedCodeInfo object with the optional fifth</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// parameter.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Return a copy of the specified function and add it to that</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function&#39;s module.  Also, any references specified in the VMap are changed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to refer to their mapped value instead of the original one.  If any of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// arguments to the function are in the VMap, the arguments are deleted from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the resultant function.  The VMap is updated to include mappings from all of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// the instructions and basicblocks in the function from their old to new</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// values.  The final argument captures information about the cloned code if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// non-null.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\pre VMap contains no non-identity GlobalValue mappings.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Clone OldFunc into NewFunc, transforming the old arguments into references</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// to VMap values.  Note that if NewFunc already has basic blocks, the ones</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// cloned into it will be added to the end of the function.  This function</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// fills in a list of return instructions, and can optionally remap types</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and/or append the specified suffix to all values cloned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If \\p Changes is \\a CloneFunctionChangeType::LocalChangesOnly, VMap is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// required to contain no non-identity GlobalValue mappings. Otherwise,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// referenced metadata will be cloned.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If \\p Changes is less than \\a CloneFunctionChangeType::DifferentModule</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// indicating cloning into the same module (even if it&#39;s LocalChangesOnly), if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// debug info metadata transitively references a \\a DISubprogram, it will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// cloned, effectively upgrading \\p Changes to GlobalChanges while suppressing</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// cloning of types and compile units.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="160"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="161"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If \\p Changes is \\a CloneFunctionChangeType::DifferentModule, the new</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This works exactly like CloneFunctionInto,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00217" /><CodeLine lineNumber="217"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// except that it does some simple constant prop and DCE on the fly.  The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// effect of this is to copy significantly less code in cases where (for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// example) a function call with constant arguments is inlined, and those</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00220" /><CodeLine lineNumber="220"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// constant arguments cause a significant amount of code in the callee to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00221" /><CodeLine lineNumber="221"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// dead.  Since this doesn&#39;t produce an exactly copy of the input, it can&#39;t be</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00223" /><CodeLine lineNumber="223"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Collect debug information such as types, compile units, and other</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// What debug information should be processed depends on \\p Changes: when</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// cloning into the same module we process \\p F&#39;s subprogram and instructions;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// when into a cloned module, neither of those.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Returns DISubprogram of the cloned function when cloning into the same</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlight">DISubprogram &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ad9d4e85b3abfbf1a3dd8a7fd45057cce">CollectDebugInfoForCloning</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Function &amp;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#a96d73bbd7af15cb1fc38c3f4a3bd82e9">F</a>,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Based on \\p Changes and \\p DIFinder return debug info that needs to be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// identity mapped during Metadata cloning.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// NOTE: Such \\a MetadataSetTy can be used by \\a CloneFunction&#42; to directly</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// specify metadata that should be identity mapped (and hence not cloned). The</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// metadata will be identity mapped in \\a ValueToValueMapTy on first use. There</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// are several reasons for doing it this way rather than eagerly identity</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// mapping metadata nodes in a \\a ValueMap:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 1 Mapping metadata is not cheap, particularly because of tracking.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 2 When cloning a Function we identity map lots of global module-level</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    metadata to avoid cloning it, while only a fraction of it is actually</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    used by the function. Mapping on first use is a lot faster for modules</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    with meaningful amount of debug info.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// 3 Eagerly identity mapping metadata makes it harder to cache module-level</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///    data (e.g. a set of metadata nodes in a \\a DICompileUnit).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a91897d2d0da113b016f14ae110586ab1">MetadataSetTy</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a954c742913f42266852b86ca04547929">FindDebugInfoToIdentityMap</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#abe00617fc34ceb1aa0eb62995732b30a">CloneFunctionChangeType</a> Changes,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                         DebugInfoFinder &amp;DIFinder,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                         DISubprogram &#42;SPClonedWithinModule);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00309" /><CodeLine lineNumber="309"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00310" /><CodeLine lineNumber="310"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This function inlines the called function into the basic</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00311" /><CodeLine lineNumber="311"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// block of the caller.  This returns false if it is not possible to inline</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00312" /><CodeLine lineNumber="312"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// this call.  The program is still in a well defined state if this occurs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00313" /><CodeLine lineNumber="313"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// though.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00314" /><CodeLine lineNumber="314"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00315" /><CodeLine lineNumber="315"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that this only does one level of inlining.  For example, if the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00316" /><CodeLine lineNumber="316"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instruction &#39;call B&#39; is inlined, and &#39;B&#39; calls &#39;C&#39;, then the call to &#39;C&#39; now</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00317" /><CodeLine lineNumber="317"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// exists in the instruction stream.  Similarly this will inline a recursive</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00318" /><CodeLine lineNumber="318"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// function by one level.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00319" /><CodeLine lineNumber="319"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00320" /><CodeLine lineNumber="320"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that while this routine is allowed to cleanup and optimize the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00321" /><CodeLine lineNumber="321"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// &#42;inlined&#42; code to minimize the actual inserted code, it must not delete</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="322"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// code in the caller as users of this routine may have pointers to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="323"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// instructions in the caller that need to remain stable.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="324"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00325" /><CodeLine lineNumber="325"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// If ForwardVarArgsTo is passed, inlining a function with varargs is allowed</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00326" /><CodeLine lineNumber="326"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and all varargs at the callsite will be passed to any calls to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="327"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// ForwardVarArgsTo. The caller of InlineFunction has to make sure any varargs</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// are only used by ForwardVarArgsTo.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00330" /><CodeLine lineNumber="330"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The callee&#39;s function attributes are merged into the callers&#39; if</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="331"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// MergeAttributes is set to true.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="332"><span class="doxyHighlight">InlineResult <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab5a3ac0a249da0743dac1bd816d8e5d5">InlineFunction</a>(CallBase &amp;CB, InlineFunctionInfo &amp;IFI,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="337"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00361" /><CodeLine lineNumber="361"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Remaps instructions in \\p Blocks using the mapping in \\p VMap.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00362" /><CodeLine lineNumber="362"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab8ec5c940fbc440c992716fbe4a48636">remapInstructionsInBlocks</a>(ArrayRef&lt;BasicBlock &#42;&gt; Blocks,</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00364" /><CodeLine lineNumber="364"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00365" /><CodeLine lineNumber="365"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Split edge between BB and PredBB and duplicate all non-Phi instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00366" /><CodeLine lineNumber="366"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// from BB between its beginning and the StopAt instruction into the split</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00367" /><CodeLine lineNumber="367"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// block. Phi nodes are not duplicated, but their uses are handled correctly:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00368" /><CodeLine lineNumber="368"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// we replace them with the uses of corresponding Phi inputs. ValueMapping</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00369" /><CodeLine lineNumber="369"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// is used to map the original instructions from BB to their newly-created</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00370" /><CodeLine lineNumber="370"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// copies. Returns the split block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00371" /><CodeLine lineNumber="371"><span class="doxyHighlight">BasicBlock &#42;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a4cd89ca702a817aac3a4521dd2462a2e">DuplicateInstructionsInSplitBetween</a>(BasicBlock &#42;BB,</span></CodeLine>
